definition:
A *unit triangular matrix* is a triangular matrix with $1$ on the
diagonal.\
i.e.

A *unit upper triangular matrix* is of the form

$$\begin{bmatrix}
1 & a_{12} & a_{13} & \cdots & a_{1n} \\
0 & 1 & a_{23} & \cdots & a_{2n} \\
0 & 0 & 1 & \cdots & a_{3n} \\
\vdots & \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\
0 & 0 & 0 & \cdots & 1
\end{bmatrix}$$

and is sometimes called a *unit right triangular matrix*.

A *unit lower triangular matrix* is of the form

$$\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0 & 0 & \cdots & 0 \\
a_{21} & 1 & 0 & \cdots & 0 \\
a_{31} & a_{32} & 1 & \cdots & 0 \\
\vdots & \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\
a_{n1} & a_{n2} & a_{n3} & \cdots & 1
\end{bmatrix}$$

and is sometimes called a *unit left triangular matrix*.
